intro: Garrya mexicana, commonly known as Mexican olive, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to Mexico and parts of Central America, typically growing in moist, well-drained soils in forested areas. The plant produces small, inconspicuous greenish-white flowers that bloom in early spring. Its fruit is a small, fleshy berry that ripens to a dark red or black color, attracting various birds and small mammals. The leaves are evergreen, oval-shaped, and have a leathery texture, contributing to its ornamental value in landscaping.
